title: "A Mistake": Zelensky Brushes Off Biden's Putin Mix-Up
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said his US counterpart Joe Biden accidentally referring to him as Russian President Vladimir Putin was a mistake that could be forgotten about given all the support the US has provided to Ukraine.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said his US counterpart Joe Biden accidentally referring to him as Russian President Vladimir Putin was a mistake that could be forgotten about given all the support the US has provided to Ukraine.

title: US Cop Under Probe After He Sexted With Married Woman While On Duty
content: Laura Cisneros told the outlet that she and Castillo never had sexual intercourse, but they did make out in a car. She has since ended the relationship.
summary: Laura Cisneros told the outlet that she and Castillo never had sexual intercourse, but they did make out in a car. She has since ended the relationship.

title: 33 Indian Farm Labourers Freed From "Slavery" By Italy Police
content: Italian police said on Saturday they had freed 33 Indian farm labourers from slave-like working conditions in the northern Verona province and seized almost half a million euros ($545,300) from their two alleged abusers.
summary: Italian police said on Saturday they had freed 33 Indian farm labourers from slave-like working conditions in the northern Verona province and seized almost half a million euros ($545,300) from their two alleged abusers.

title: Brazilian Drug Lord Arrested After Wife's Instagram Post Reveals Location
content: Last week, his wife Andrezza De Lima posted a photo that included a distinct landmark, enabling police to pinpoint their exact location.
summary: Last week, his wife Andrezza De Lima posted a photo that included a distinct landmark, enabling police to pinpoint their exact location.

title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan's Illegal Marriage Conviction Overturned
content: A Pakistan court overturned ex-Prime Minister Imran Khan's conviction on illegal marriage charges on Saturday, though he remains jailed over allegations of inciting riots.
summary: A Pakistan court overturned ex-Prime Minister Imran Khan's conviction on illegal marriage charges on Saturday, though he remains jailed over allegations of inciting riots.

title: Kate Middleton To Attend Wimbledon Men's Finals Tomorrow: Palace
content: Catherine, Princess of Wales, will attend the Wimbledon Men's final in London on Sunday as she recovers after being diagnosed with cancer, her Kensington Palace office said.
summary: Catherine, Princess of Wales, will attend the Wimbledon Men's final in London on Sunday as she recovers after being diagnosed with cancer, her Kensington Palace office said.

title: Israel Targets Hamas Military Chief, Gaza Officials Say 71 Killed In Strike
content: An Israeli airstrike targeted Hamas' military chief Mohammed Deif in Gaza on Saturday, a security official and Israel Army Radio said, in an attack that the enclave's health ministry said had killed at least 71 Palestinians.
summary: An Israeli airstrike targeted Hamas' military chief Mohammed Deif in Gaza on Saturday, a security official and Israel Army Radio said, in an attack that the enclave's health ministry said had killed at least 71 Palestinians.

title: US President Joe Biden Signs Law To Resolve China's Occupation Of Tibet
content: US President Joe Biden today signed "The Resolve Tibet Act" which states that China's ongoing occupation of Tibet must be resolved per the international law peacefully and not through repression.
summary: US President Joe Biden today signed "The Resolve Tibet Act" which states that China's ongoing occupation of Tibet must be resolved per the international law peacefully and not through repression.

title: "Didn't Want To Wake Her Up": UK Man's Choice Leads To Baby's Death In Car
content: A two-year-old girl named Parker Scholtes died after being left in a hot car for several hours in Marana, Arizona. Her father, Christopher Scholtes, left her sleeping in the car with the air conditioning on, but the vehicle later shut off.
summary: A two-year-old girl named Parker Scholtes died after being left in a hot car for several hours in Marana, Arizona. Her father, Christopher Scholtes, left her sleeping in the car with the air conditioning on, but the vehicle later shut off.

title: UN Agency For Palestinians Says It Has Funds For Only 2 More Months
content: The head of the UN agency for Palestinian refugees said Friday it had enough funds to continue operating through September, following a pledging conference for the embattled body where UN chief Antonio Guterres pleaded for help from donors.
summary: The head of the UN agency for Palestinian refugees said Friday it had enough funds to continue operating through September, following a pledging conference for the embattled body where UN chief Antonio Guterres pleaded for help from donors.

title: Bodies Of 2 Men Inside Suitcases Found On UK Bridge, 24-Year-Old Arrested
content: UK police on Saturday arrested a man after two suitcases believed to contain the remains of two men were dumped on a famous bridge.
summary: UK police on Saturday arrested a man after two suitcases believed to contain the remains of two men were dumped on a famous bridge.

title: Nepal Searches For 63 People Missing After Massive Highway Landslide
content: Nepali rescue teams resumed their search early Saturday for at least 63 people missing after monsoon rains triggered a landslide that swept two buses off a highway and into a river.
summary: Nepali rescue teams resumed their search early Saturday for at least 63 people missing after monsoon rains triggered a landslide that swept two buses off a highway and into a river.

title: US Election 2024: A History Of Biden's Gaffes And All The Oops Moments
content: US President Joe Biden has made numerous verbal stumbles and gaffes over the years. From verbal slip-ups to near-fall incidents, Mr Biden, whose age is often targeted by opposition leaders and remains a concern for voters, has had all.
summary: US President Joe Biden has made numerous verbal stumbles and gaffes over the years. From verbal slip-ups to near-fall incidents, Mr Biden, whose age is often targeted by opposition leaders and remains a concern for voters, has had all.

title: Ireland Bans This Dog Breed After Fatal Attack Results In Woman's Death
content: The XL bully, the largest breed of American bully dogs, is known for its muscular build and strength and is already regulated in the UK.
summary: The XL bully, the largest breed of American bully dogs, is known for its muscular build and strength and is already regulated in the UK.

title: Pakistan Secures $7 Billion Loan Deal With IMF To Boost Faltering Economy
content: The International Monetary Fund said it reached a new $7 billion loan deal with Pakistan in a bid to bolster its faltering economy.
summary: The International Monetary Fund said it reached a new $7 billion loan deal with Pakistan in a bid to bolster its faltering economy.

title: Russian, US Defence Chiefs Discuss Lowering Escalation Over Phone Call
content: Russian Defence Minister Andrei Belousov and his US counterpart Lloyd Austin held a telephone call where they discussed lowering the risk of "possible escalation", the Russian defence ministry said on Friday.
summary: Russian Defence Minister Andrei Belousov and his US counterpart Lloyd Austin held a telephone call where they discussed lowering the risk of "possible escalation", the Russian defence ministry said on Friday.

title: King Charles Buys $6.63 Million House In US, Closer To Prince Harry
content: The three-bedroom condo spans 3,601 square feet and features stunning city views, a swimming pool, and a sauna.
summary: The three-bedroom condo spans 3,601 square feet and features stunning city views, a swimming pool, and a sauna.

title: Meta Removes Restrictions On Trump's Facebook, Instagram Accounts
content: Meta said Friday it was lifting restrictions on US presidential candidate Donald Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts, ending measures put in place after his supporters violently stormed the US Capitol in 2021.
summary: Meta said Friday it was lifting restrictions on US presidential candidate Donald Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts, ending measures put in place after his supporters violently stormed the US Capitol in 2021.

title: From FLiRT To FLuQE: What To Know About The Latest Covid Variants
content: SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID) is responsible for recurring waves of infection as it continues to evolve and mutate into new variants which keep it a step ahead of our immunity.
summary: SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID) is responsible for recurring waves of infection as it continues to evolve and mutate into new variants which keep it a step ahead of our immunity.

title: US Airline Apologises Amid Row Over Cabin Crew Wearing Palestine Flag Pin
content: Delta Air Lines has found itself embroiled in a huge controversy over its social media post on the Palestinian flag.
summary: Delta Air Lines has found itself embroiled in a huge controversy over its social media post on the Palestinian flag.
